qas.question: Who was one of Apollo's male lovers?
What hit Hyacinthus in the head, killing him?
Who blew the discus off course, killing Hyacinthus?
What item did Apollo create and name after his lover?

context: Hyacinth or <a0_0>Hyacinthus<a0_0/> was one of Apollo's male lovers. He was a Spartan prince, beautiful and athletic. The pair was practicing throwing the discus when a <a1_0>discus<a1_0/> thrown by Apollo was blown off course by the jealous <a2_0>Zephyrus<a2_0/> and struck Hyacinthus in the head, killing him instantly. Apollo is said to be filled with grief: out of Hyacinthus' blood, Apollo created a <a3_0>flower<a3_0/> named after him as a memorial to his death, and his tears stained the flower petals with the interjection αἰαῖ, meaning alas. The Festival of Hyacinthus was a celebration of Sparta.
